company_context: Colyseus - Open-source Multiplayer Framework for Node.js Free and Open-source Multiplayer Framework Own your authoritative game servers. Versatile for any genre or platform. npm create colyseus-app@latest ./my-server Copied! * Requires Node.js installed. Meet Colyseus Features Automatic state synchronization . Match-make clients into game rooms on demand . Scale to millions across different game rooms . Authoritative server to prevent hacks on the client. Leverage the ever-growing JavaScript ecosystem . Open-source, under the most permissive MIT License . Supports your favorite engine & platform JavaScript/TypeScript Unity Construct 3 Defold Engine Haxe 4 Cocos Creator Discover The Colyseus Framework Trusted and Loved by Indies and Studios Worldwide "...the operational cost associated with running a Colyseus server is substantially lower than alternatives we tried." Adrian Olczyc - CEO at Eleven Puzzles "I had previously never worked with Websockets, authoritative multiplayer servers, or Node.js. But that wasnâ€™t a problem, as Colyseus provided me with an intuitive start. This strong foundation allowed us to grow to where we are today." Sandro Wahl - Creator of Make it Meme "We have been in love with Colyseus since the first moment we discovered it. It is amazing to have such an extraordinary product available for free and as open source." Pablo and Eibriel - Creators of GolfCraft View Success Stories Games using Colyseus A selection of multiplayer games made by happy developers. No ops required. Get started from $15/mo Speak with an expert Learn more

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex, and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their data workflows. I came across Colyseus and was impressed by the work you're doing in the gaming industry. Can you tell me a bit about your current data processing challenges?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Ah, yeah, we're doing alright. We've got a pretty lean team, and we're focused on building out our multiplayer framework. I'm not sure we have a lot of pain points around data processing at the moment. What makes you think we'd be a good fit for DeepData AI?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Well, from what I've seen, companies in the gaming space often deal with large amounts of user data, and our solution can help streamline that process. We've had success with similar companies in the past, and I think we could help you reduce costs and improve efficiency. Would you be open to exploring how our solution could help Colyseus?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the pitch, but to be honest, we're pretty happy with our current setup. We're using a combination of open-source tools and custom solutions, and it's working for us. I'm not sure we'd be willing to invest in a new solution at this time, especially if it's going to add significant cost to our bottom line. What kind of pricing are we talking about?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Our pricing is competitive, and we offer a tiered system based on the amount of data being processed. I'd be happy to provide a custom quote for your team. However, I want to assure you that our solution can help you save money in the long run by reducing the need for manual data processing and minimizing errors.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I understand what you're saying, but like I said, we're not really feeling the pain right now. And even if we were, I'm not sure we'd be ready to move forward with a new solution at this time. We're in the middle of a big development push, and our resources are stretched thin. Can you just send me an email with some more information, and we can revisit this conversation in a few months?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Absolutely, I can send over some more information. But before I do, can I ask, are there any specific concerns or objections you have about our solution that I can address in the email?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: No, I think it's just a matter of timing and priorities for us. Please, just send me an email, and we'll take a look. But I want to be clear, we're not planning on moving forward with any new solutions at this time, so I wouldn't want you to follow up with a call. Just an email will be fine, thank you.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively explored and addressed the buyer's current pain points and priorities to better understand their needs and potentially uncover opportunities to add value. Sentiment: Neutral
